textboxes.description: You arrive at the local voting pool, a long line of citizens waiting to cast their votes. The election is crucial, and the candidates are well-known: Bill Clinton and George Bush. You know that your choice matters, and you're ready to make your voice heard.
You cast your vote for Bill Clinton, feeling the weight of the decision. You understand the importance of the upcoming years and hope your choice will make a difference.

choices.text: Leave the voting pool and head home
Talk to a fellow voter about your choice

textboxes.description: You cast your vote for George Bush, feeling confident in your decision. You know that this election could shape the future and hope for positive changes.

choices.text: Leave the voting pool and head home
Talk to a fellow voter about your choice

textboxes.description: You turn to the person next to you and start a conversation about the election. They share their views passionately, and you feel engaged in the political process. Despite differences, the exchange is respectful and enlightening.

choices.text: Continue the conversation and debate further

textboxes.description: The conversation turns heated, but you manage to keep your cool. The person seems to respect your opinions, even if they disagree. You both leave the voting pool with a sense of mutual understanding.

choices.text: Leave the voting pool and head home

textboxes.description: You’ve cast your vote and had an engaging conversation. Whether or not your candidate wins, you feel like you’ve done your part in the democratic process.
